Package spring.caches.backend

Class Platform

java.lang.Object
spring.caches.backend.Platform
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultPlatform
public abstract class Platform extends Object
The Platform class is responsible for providing any platform specific APIs, including the mechanism by which cache backends are created.

  • Method Details

    • getBackend

      public static BackendFactory getBackend​(String type)
      Returns a cache backend of the given class name for use by a Spring Boot Caches Provider. Note that the returned backend need not be unique; one backend could be used by multiple cache providers. The given class name must be in the normal dot-separated form (e.g. "com.example.Foo$Bar") rather than the internal binary format (e.g. "com/example/Foo$Bar").
      Parameters:
      type - the fully-qualified name of the Java class to which the cache is associated. The cache name is derived from this string in a platform specific way.

    • getBackendFactoryNames

      public static Set<String> getBackendFactoryNames()

    • getConfigInfo

      public static String getConfigInfo()
      Returns a human-readable string describing the platform and its configuration. This should contain everything a human would need to see to check that the Platform was configured as expected. It should contain the platform name along with any configurable elements (e.g. cache providers) and their settings. It is recommended (though not required) that this string is formatted with one piece of configuration per line in a tabular format, such as: 
      
 platform: <human readable name>
      It is not required that this string be machine parseable (though it should be stable).
